last_episode_to_air.name: The End of WWII in Europe
last_episode_to_air.overview: The Red Army's capture of Berlin and the surrender of the Nazis are depicted by an American war reporter’s writing and an interrogation interview.

name: Voices of Liberation
overview: The writings and eyewitness accounts of wartime participants help trace the story of Europe's liberation during WWII in this historical docuseries.

episodes.name: Preparing for D-Day
episodes.overview: A letter from Stalin, a British soldier's diary entry and a message from a US soldier to his mother help illustrate the Allies' preparation for D-Day.

episodes.name: D-Day
episodes.overview: A message intercepted by Bletchley Park, a US soldier’s interview and a dispatch from Stalin to Churchill help to depict the harrowing events of D-Day.

episodes.name: The Battle of Normandy
episodes.overview: The taxing Allied campaign to liberate Normandy inspires a British officer's poem, a US soldier’s letter to his brother and a speech from Eisenhower.

episodes.name: The Liberation of Paris
episodes.overview: A Parisian’s diary, a letter by a member of the French Resistance and a French officer’s journal narrate the liberation of Paris from German occupation.

episodes.name: The Liberation of Brussels and Antwerp
episodes.overview: A radio message from Eisenhower and a newspaper article help to describe the demanding Allied push to liberate Belgium.

episodes.name: Operation Market Garden
episodes.overview: A British soldier’s letter, a note from Eisenhower and an officer’s poem illuminate the ill-fated Allied operation in the Netherlands.

episodes.name: The Battle of the Scheldt and Texel
episodes.overview: To secure the Scheldt, the Allies mounted a difficult campaign as revealed by an officer's diary, a soldier's letter and a British radio message.

episodes.name: The Horror of Hürtgenwald
episodes.overview: A mother’s poem and a passage from a Hemingway novel lay bare the Allied offensive into the treacherous Hürtgen Forest.

episodes.name: The Battle of the Bulge
episodes.overview: A letter from Montgomery to Eisenhower and an impassioned speech by Patton illustrate the fierce campaign in the Ardennes region of Belgium.

episodes.name: Over the Rhine and to the Camps
episodes.overview: An interview from a war correspondent and a US soldier’s letter help describe the Allied crossing of the Rhine and the liberation of concentration camps.

episodes.name: The End of WWII in Europe
episodes.overview: The Red Army's capture of Berlin and the surrender of the Nazis are depicted by an American war reporter’s writing and an interrogation interview.
